result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Earl Carr #00599962 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked, all conditions of probation will apply to extended supervision as well.

miscConds.notes:
1) While in custody, the court may garnish any of the defendant's DOC accounts via prison wage assignment.  Once released from custody, the defendant shall pay $100 per month until paid in full.
2) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
3) If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

1) No contact with the victims, their residence, or their cabin; with the exception of an apology letter- if the defendant wishes to write one- which must be routed through the victim witness coordinator.  
2) No possession of any burglarious tools.
3) Defendant shall not vote in any election until their civil rights are restored. 
4) The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety- no use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life.

1) The defendant shall undergo regular drug testing.
2) The defendant shall maintain gainful employment.
3) The defendant shall complete a parenting class.
4) If revoked, the defendant is eligible for both Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse programming, but may only participate in the Substance Abuse program if he is unable to participate in the Challenge Incarceration program.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Earl Carr #00599962

defendant.name: Carr #00599962, Richard Earl

records.addlTxt:
9:11 AM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard Earl Carr #00599962 appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak appeared by video for Richard Earl Carr #00599962.  Case is on for Sentencing Hearing.  Parties acknowledge receipt of PSI, Atty Pollak makes one correction RE: Dunn County case;  State proposes no corrections or modifications.  State argues for 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES; no contact with victim, programming per DOC.  Court notes agreement differs; DA amends argument, recommendation.  Defense attorney argues for 2 yrs ES and 2 yrs IC, imposed stayed w/3 yrs probation; stipulation to $1,000 restitution.  Defendant answers questions of the Court, makes a statement.  
Court orders: 
3 yrs probation, 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES imposed and stayed
Conditions of Probation:
$518 court costs; $100 per month until paid in full (to begin once released from custody; wage assignment to be sent to prison while in custody).
$1,000 restitution as stipulated; if def is released from supervision with financial obligations outstanding, a civil judgment will be entered against the defendant.
No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription, absolute sobriety, regular drug testing, no possession of any burglarious tools, no firearms for life, no voting until civil rights are restored, gainful employment, complete a parenting class.  Report to probation immediately.  No contact with the victims, their residence, or cabin (outside of an apology letter that would need to be routed through VW coordinator- if def wishes to send one).  Eligible for SAP and CIP if revoked; would need to first apply to CIP- if denied will be eligible for SAP.  
Defendant must provide DNA and fingerprints to the BCSD.  Appeal rights provided.

2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard Earl Carr #00599962 appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Richard Earl Carr #00599962.  Def appearing from Stanley Correctional, waives in person hearing KIV.  Court makes a record as to the purpose of today's hearing (parts of plea colloquy was missed at previous hearing).  Def understands, wishes for his plea to stand as entered KIV.  Off the record 2:04 PM. Back on the record 2:09 PM, same appearances.  Def wishes to waive in person appearance for the next hearing, Court approved.
Status conference on June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Sentencing hearing on August 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice forwarded to schedulers at Stanley Correctional on 5/27/22.

02:04 PM Defendant Richard Earl Carr #00599962 in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Defendant in custody, appearing from Stanley Correctional Institution.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin. Richard Earl Carr #00599962 appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant advised of rights to in person hearing, waived KIV.  Case is on for plea/sentencing hearing.  Agreement is recited by Atty Pollak- Def stipulates to $1,000 restitution, entering a plea to a Class H felony count of Theft, movable property $5k-$10k, joint rec for 3 years probation with 2 years IC 2 yrs ES imposed/stayed; with or without PSI.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  State moves to amend Count 1 as stated; granted.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty to amended Count 1: Theft, movable property ($5k-$10k).  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Amended Count 1 and orders a JOC; Count 2 is DRI.  State assures VR compliance.  Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present, but should be available by phone- if needed- for sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

03:10 PM Defendant Richard Earl Carr #00599962 in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Defendant in custody fom Stanley Correctional Facility.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Richard Earl Carr #00599962 appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Requesting Plea/sentencing.  Offer recited by atty Pollak- plead to amended fel theft (PTOAC) w/stipulated restitution (not to be prepaid), 3 yrs probation, imposed/stayed 2 yrs IC and 2 yrs ES.  Off the record 3:14 PM.  Back on the record 3:14 PM.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Arraignment on April 13, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Notice sent to Stanley Correctional Schedulers 3/28/22.

03:18 PM Defendant Richard Earl Carr #00599962 in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Richard Earl Carr #00599962 appeared by video means from Stanley Correctional Facility with Attorney in person.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information.  Separate arraignment requested.  Arraignment scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
